titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Committee to Frame a World Constitution Records1945-1951

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Committee to Frame a World Constitution. Records

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Committee to Frame a World Constitution was first convened in the fall of 1945 as part of the post-World War II World Federalist movement. The Records contain correspondence and miscellaneous material reflecting the close relations between the Committee and other organizations advocating some form of world government. The papers are comprised of the files of the Committee secretariat, which was also the editorial staff for the journal Common Cause.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Committee to Frame a World Constitution. Records, [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: After a Round Table Discussion on 12 August 1945, in the course of which University of Chicago Chancellor Hutchins emphasized the need for world government, Richard P. McKeon and G. A. Borgese wrote to the Chancellor asking him for financial and moral support for an institute to formulate a world constitution. On 16 September 1945. Hutchins gave his support and by November 1945 the first document was presented for consideration by the Committee. In 1947 The Preliminary Draft of a World Constitution (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1948) was published. From June 1947 through June 1951 the Committee published a journal, Common Cause, devoted to articles concerned with problems relevant to the issue of world government and how to affect it.

The members of the Committee at the time of the publication of the Draft were: Robert M. Hutchins, G. A. Borgese, Mortimer J. Adler, Stringfellow Barr, Albert Guérard, Harold A. Innis, Erich Kahler, Wilber G. Katz, Charles H. McIlwain, Robert Redfield, and Rexford G. Tugwell. Additionally, Elisabeth Mann Borgese worked as a research assistant for the Committee and later editor of the journal Common Cause.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The Committee to Frame a World Constitution Records contains correspondence and miscellaneous material. This collection reflects the close relations between the Committee and other organizations advocating some form of world government. Specifically, the papers are comprised of the files of the Committee secretariat, which was also the editorial staff for Common Cause. They include the 150 documents used as the basis for the discussions in the thirteen meetings of the Committee; the stenographic transcriptions of the meetings; a complete set of Common Cause and a single copy of The Draft. The Records also include correspondence concerning Committee administrative matters, publication, and business arrangements, comments on Common Cause and the preliminary draft of the Constitution, and miscellaneous manuscript materials.
The Committee to Frame a World Constitution Records are divided into six series.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.corpname: Committee to Frame a World Constitution
controlaccess.subject: International organization
World politics

did.unittitle: Series I: Administrative and Financial Papers

scopecontent.p: This series includes inter-office memoranda to the Committee staff; inter-University memoranda concerning housekeeping matters; some subscription matters; correspondence with authors concerning copies of articles; intra-Committee correspondence; magazine exchange arrangements; and correspondence relating to lay-out and publication of Common Cause. (This material is often supplemented in Series II, Correspondence.)

did.unittitle: Office-Personnel (Letters requesting positions; personnel records of employees), 1946-1951
Office-Personnel (Letters requesting positions; personnel records of employees), 1946-1951
Office-Personnel (Memoranda to employees of Committee; Phoenix Correspondence, November-December 1947), 1946-1951

scopecontent.p: This series consists of the correspondence to Common Cause requesting copies, information, and subscriptions; correspondence with authors; concerning dissemination of the journal; personal-official letters with various leaders and organizations in the World Federation Movement; business arrangements of the Committee and its Journal with other organizations; publishing and printing matters; letters of transmittal of Preliminary Draft and copies of Journal; a few letters including individual plans for world government. This material is arranged alphabetically and in the order in which it was received from the Committee.

did.unittitle: Information Letters (concerning Common Cause or the Committee), 1950
Miscellaneous, General Correspondence (1 Dec. 1948-14 Sept. 1949) II, 1948-1949
Parallel Organization, Students for Federal World Government (Student Federalists), 1946-1947
Parallel Organization, The United World Federalists, 1947-1949
Parallel Organization, Wereld Federalisten Beweging Nederland, 1950
Publicity Material, N.B. Press, University of Chicago: SEE University of Chicago Press, 1948-1951
Subscriptions: Periodicals (General); General Material and Subscriptions to Magazines, 1948-1951
Series III: Common Cause and the Preliminary Draft Files

scopecontent.p: This series includes letters to the Committee and the Journal commenting upon the Draft Constitution and/or the Journal of the Committee, Common Cause, and its articles. Many of the letters are from correspondents who have plans of their own and are bringing them to the attention of the Committee and the Journal.

did.unittitle: Preliminary Draft of a World Constitution, 1947
The Committee to Frame a World Constitution, Preliminary Draft of a World Constitution, 1948
Errata to Preliminary Draft of a World Constitution, 1948
Common Cause, Vol. 1, no. 9, "Preliminary Draft of a World Constitution," 1948

scopecontent.p: This series consists of manuscript copies of articles appearing in the Journal, lectures, and speeches by men prominent or connected with the Committee or the Journal relevant to the World Federation Movement, e.g., Borgese, Hutchins, Quincy Wright, and others. The series also includes typescript, holograph, and mimeographed copies of the documents issued by the Committee in the Document Series 1-150.

did.unittitle: Proposals for amendment of the United Nations Charter, 1946
Original and unmimeographed copies of Documents 1-9, 1945-1946
Original and unmimeographed copies of Documents 10-28, 1945-1946
Original and unmimeographed copies of Documents 29-53, 1945-1946
Document 147, Constitutional Drafts basis for Document 147, 1947-1948
Document 147, Constitutional Drafts basis for Document 147, 1947-1948
Original copies of Document 148 and 149, includes detailed comment upon various segments of the Constitution by individuals whose opinions had been solicited, 1947-1948

scopecontent.p: This series is made up of mimeographed copies of Committee Documents 1--150. These documents consist of the original proposals and plans for the Committee, and the various papers submitted by its members to be used as a basis for discussion and the eventual formation of a Preliminary Draft Constitution.
This series includes the stenographic transcripts of the Committee Meetings, mimeographed.
